Investigating with Veronika

The investigation revealed that the SWT classes are not being found.
Indeed this is normal since the SWT fragment is not listed in the target platform.
This seems to be pretty bad given that it prevents any selfhosting on macos if
you don't have swt loaded.

In the meantime, Pascal, could you please put a breakpoint in 
TargetPlatformRegistryLoader in pde.core and see why the fragment is not 
making it into the state.  Thanks.

Eclipse on Mac requires a Java 1.4.2 VM (mentioned in clickthrough for Mac download).
(Note: Eclipse works with 1.4.1 but selfhosting requires 1.4.2).
Thanks Andre.  I can go home now... :-)
I'm already at home :-)

.log contents

BTW, under Jaguar the fragment org.eclipse.swt.carbon is not listed.in Window -> Preferences 
Target Platform.

I see the problem on Panther - have not yet tried it with Jaguar.  Andre, in 
your log file I see that you are using JVM 1.4.1 on Jaguar.  Why is a 1.4.2 VM 
required by Eclipse on the Mac?

Veronika, IIRC one reason was bug #56037, another is that Java 1.4.2 seems to be the recommended 
VM for Panther (Software Update will find it automatically).

(BTW, on Jaguar I'm running Java 1.4.1 because there is no Java 1.4.2 for Jaguar).

Although this bug seems to be fixed by a jdk1.4.2, I was still surprised by this and investigated 
since the platform could start with 1.4.1.

What I discovered was that the manifest.mf of the swt.carbon fragment did not had a carriage 
return at the end. This seems silly, but it was upseting the Manifest reader in 1.4.1 and not in 
1.4.2.
Therefore the fix is trivial. I will come to see you Veronika.

Although this is an SWT problem, it would have been WAY WAY WAY easier to track if PDE did not 
consumed the bundleException without even logging it !!!!

I think I will also change the Mac click through to require 1.4.1 or higher 
when this bug is fixed.  Unless we have a specific requirement for 1.4.2, it 
does not make sense to me to force people to upgrade.
*** Bug 56037 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I have released the change to the SWT carbon fragment manifest file and 
updated the mac clickthrough.

I am not closing this bug report yet because there still remains the issue of 
why the bundleException was consumed without logging it.
